intro: Pogogyne tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered pogogyne, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded woodland environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
